DOC.brief_summary: Constipation of different etiology might respond differently to probiotic intervention. Lactobacillus casei strain Shirota (LcS) is a well-studied probiotic which effectively alleviate constipation. Constipation subjects were recruited according to ROME Ⅲ criteria. According to Bristol Stool Form Scale (BS), subjects were divided into 3 groups: hard stool (HS, BS<3), normal stool (NS, 3≤BS≤4) and soft stool (SS, 4<BS<5). Subjects consumed 100mL per day of a probiotic beverage containing 1.0 × 108 CFU/mL of LcS for 28 days. The change in stool consistency was measured as primary outcome. The stool short chain fatty acid and gut microbiota were also assessed.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Probiotic on Constipation With Diverse Stool Consistency
DOC.criteria: meet ROME Ⅲ criteria for functional constipation normal body mass index between 18.5 and 29.9 had a serious disease; used systemic antibiotics or antimycotics medication and antidiarrheal or laxative medication in the 30 days prior to the study; allergic to milk protein; constipated because of organic or neurological lesions; participated in any other studies within 2 months prior to this study.
